intro: Otochlamys pedunculata, commonly known as the red sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that range in color from red to purple, often with a distinctive two-lipped structure. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments, making it a hardy and drought-tolerant species. Its botanical features make it an attractive addition to xeriscapic gardens and a valuable plant for ecological restoration projects.
